name: Buttermilk-Banana Scones
description: Tender, buttery scones with a lovely hint of cinnamon. Infused with moisture and flavor from the ripe bananas. These are a tasty way to start the day-perfect with some tea or coffee!
recipeIngredient: 2 ¾ cups all-purpose flour, or more as needed
½ cup cold butter, cut into pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with a silicon mat (such as Silpat®).

Combine 2 3/4 cups flour, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a medium bowl; stir to blend. Toss in cold butter and cut it into the dry mixture with a pastry cutter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.

Blend mashed bananas, buttermilk, and vanilla together in a small bowl. Pour into the dry ingredients and stir gently until the mixture comes together. If it's a little too wet, add just a little bit more flour. Handle as lightly as possible and form into a disc on the prepared baking sheet. Gently cut into 12 wedges or just score the disc.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and baked all the way through, 22 to 28 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before moving to a rack to complete cooling.

review.reviewBody: I feel it is too moist inside for a scone. I baked it for 29 minutes, one minute  longer  than the recommended range. And the flavor was so so. I normally don’t try a recipe without reviews.

Who says scones have to be dry? This is a moist, tender version with a lot of flavor if you use VERY ripe (black) bananas.  Made these twice, once with black bananas and once with somewhat less ripe ones.  The first was intensely banana flavored, the second much milder.  Also, I divided the batter into 2 rounds and scored each into 6 pieces using a pizza knife (not the rolling kind!). Parchment worked in place of the Silpat. I'll keep making these, but I'll wait for black bananas from now on.
